13  package net.sf.oval.test.validator;
14  
15  import java.util.List;
16  
17  import junit.framework.TestCase;
18  import net.sf.oval.ConstraintViolation;
19  import net.sf.oval.Validator;
20  import net.sf.oval.constraint.Max;
21  import net.sf.oval.constraint.MaxSize;
22  import net.sf.oval.constraint.MinSize;
23  import net.sf.oval.constraint.NotNull;
24  
25  /**
26   * @author Sebastian Thomschke
27   */
28  public class PrimitiveArrayTest extends TestCase
29  {
30  	public class Account
31  	{
32  		@MinSize(value = 1, message = "MIN_SIZE")
33  		@MaxSize(value = 4, message = "MAX_SIZE")
34  		@Max(value = 10, message = "MAX")
35  		@NotNull(message = "NOT_NULL")
36  		public int[] items = new int[]{};
37  
38  	}
39  
40  	public void testPrimitiveArray()
41  	{
42  		Validator validator = new Validator();
43  		Account account = new Account();
44  
45  		// test min size
46  		List<ConstraintViolation> violations = validator.validate(account);
47  		assertEquals(1, violations.size());
48  		assertEquals("MIN_SIZE", violations.get(0).getMessage());
49  
50  		// test valid
51  		account.items = new int[]{1};
52  		violations = validator.validate(account);
53  		assertEquals(0, violations.size());
54  
55  		// test max size
56  		account.items = new int[]{1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
57  		violations = validator.validate(account);
58  		assertEquals(1, violations.size());
59  		assertEquals("MAX_SIZE", violations.get(0).getMessage());
60  
61  		// test attribute not null
62  		account.items = null;
63  		violations = validator.validate(account);
64  		assertEquals(1, violations.size());
65  		assertEquals("NOT_NULL", violations.get(0).getMessage());
66  
67  		// test elements max
68  		account.items = new int[]{1, 100};
69  		violations = validator.validate(account);
70  		assertEquals(1, violations.size());
71  		assertEquals("MAX", violations.get(0).getMessage());
72  	}
73  }
This page was automatically generated by Maven
